RoleDefinition.Title: Business Analyst
RoleDefinition.Description: A Business Analyst acts as a liaison among stakeholders in order to understand the structure, policies, and operations of an organization, and to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.

WorkExperience.Title: Junior Business Analyst
WorkExperience.Description: Involved in analyzing business processes and recommending improvements. Assisted in the documentation and reporting of business needs.

WorkExperience.Title: Senior Business Analyst
WorkExperience.Description: Led teams to analyze complex business challenges and proposed comprehensive solutions. Managed stakeholder communication and requirements gathering.

OtherRelevantInformation.Education: Typically requires a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, or related field.
Certifications: Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA)
